org.usfirst.frc.team6027.robot.subsystems

Class DriveEncoders

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • org.usfirst.frc.team6027.robot.subsystems.DriveEncoders
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class DriveEncoders
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
    A subsystem to operate the encoders located on the drivetrain.
    Author:
    Charlie Wade

    • Constructor Detail

      • DriveEncoders

        public DriveEncoders(int leftChannelA,
                     int leftChannelB,
                     int rightChannelA,
                     int rightChannelB,
                     double maxPeriod,
                     int minRate,
                     double distancePerPulse,
                     boolean reverseDirection,
                     int samplesToAverage)
        Constructs left and right encoders to be used by the subsystem
        Parameters:
        leftChannelA - DIO port for the left encoder and channel a
        leftChannelB - DIO port for the left encoder and channel b
        rightChannelA - DIO port for the right encoder and channel a
        rightChannelB - DIO port for the right encoder and channel b
        maxPeriod - max period to be considered stopped
        minRate - max rate to be considered stopped
        distancePerPulse - value to convert a pulse into a distance. This is based on encoder resolution and wheel size.
        reverseDirection - should the encoder direction be reversed
        samplesToAverage - number of samples to average to calculate period
